poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment (MIP4c2-SP31) - January 9, 2023

discourse_list.title: MIP4c2-SP31: MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment

content.content: MIP4c2-SP31: MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment  Preamble MIP4c2-SP#: #13 MIP to be amended: <MIP#0> Author(s): @blimpa Contributors: @LongForWisdom, @JuanJuan Tags: mip-amendment, mip-set Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2021-02-26 Date Ratified: 2021-04-27   Specification  Motivation After successful trial run of the beta version of MIP63, there are a few learnings that I want to incorporate for the next iteration. Specifically, more strictly defining how payments are sent and buffers reported as well as changing a few parameters. I’ve also added an explicit stream duration as previously this was just assumed to be 6 months. The Sequencer can also set custom windows per network now.  Amended MIPs and Components This MIP4c2 subproposal revises MIP63.  Amendment Pull Request   github.com/makerdao/mips         MIP63 Production Release Changes   makerdao:master ← hexonaut:mip63-update              opened 05:31PM - 02 Dec 22 UTC                 hexonaut               +31 -25       https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip4c2-spxx-mip63-maker-keeper-network-amendment/19…024         Relevant Information  The proposed code
content.GPT-summary: The post is an explanation of the MIP4c2-SP31 proposal to amend MIP63 Maker Keeper Network. The author provides a motivation for the amendment and specifies the changes made to the proposal. There is also a link to the amendment pull request and relevant information about the proposed code. Additionally, there is no 3rd party advertising, collaborating, or asking questions about the proposal, but there is constructive criticism and auditing.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Hi Sam, thanks for posting this. I wondered whether you would consider adding a requirement for budget duration to the MIP? This is something GovAlpha had previously discussed internally with regard to MIP63. For example, MIP40 contains a 12-month restriction for CU budgets, but at present, MIP63 has no such restriction. Such a restriction would encourage keepers to demonstrate to Governance that they have been providing good value to the Protocol when asking for ongoing funding.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Ah yes good idea. Previously we’ve just done 6 month defaults, but this should be specified explicitly. I need to do another pass on this and will include that.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Thanks, I’d suggest explicitly defining a maximum budget duration as well. I’ve left some suggested text here: MIP63 Production Release Changes by hexonaut · Pull Request #720 · makerdao/mips · GitHub I’ve suggested six months as a maximum duration for keeper budgets, but I’m open to being persuaded that it should be a different number.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This is a summary of the contents of this subproposal and its impact, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This is a valid subproposal MIP4c2 (Amendment Process for MIPs Older than 3 Months). This subproposal amends MIP63: Maker Keeper Network. Specifically, this amendment introduces:  Language changes for clarity and spelling fixes. A maximum duration of two years for keeper network budgets. Stricter definitions around payments and reports. A modification of required fields in the MIP63c4 subproposal template. The Keeper Network List (MIP63c5) has been updated retroactively with these modified fields.   If this subproposal is ratified, this PR will be merged into the MIP repository. This proposal has been assigned Medium-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2022-12-27
